summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
Recalling previous resolutions on Liberia and Sierra Leone, welcomes progress in preparations for Liberia's presidential and legislative elections and extension of State authority. 
Appreciates contributions by ECOWAS, AU, and the international community. 
Welcomes the Governance and Economic Management Assistance Program (GEMAP) and the essential work of the Special Court for Sierra Leone.

UNMIL's mandate is extended until 31 March 2006. 
All Liberian parties are called on to ensure peaceful, transparent, free, and fair elections. 
The international community is urged to support resources for rehabilitation and security sector reform.

UNMIL is authorized to deploy up to 250 military personnel to Sierra Leone to provide security for the Special Court. 
A temporary increase in UNMIL's personnel ceiling to 15,250 is authorized from 15 November 2005 to 31 March 2006. 
UNMIL is also authorized to deploy personnel to evacuate UNMIL personnel and Court officials in case of a security crisis.

The UN Integrated Office in Sierra Leone is requested to provide logistic support. 
The Secretary-General and the Government of Sierra Leone are requested to conclude an agreement on the status of UNMIL personnel deployed to Sierra Leone.
Supports the Secretary-General's recommendation to return to the authorized ceiling of UN military personnel by 31 March 2006; 
Encourages UN missions to enhance inter-mission cooperation, particularly on preventing cross-border arms and combatant movement, illicit resource exploitation, and disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration programmes; 
Welcomes UNMIL's efforts to implement the zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse, and requests the Secretary-General to ensure compliance, keep the Council informed, and urges troop-contributing countries to take preventive and disciplinary action; 
Requests the Secretary-General to provide a drawdown plan for UNMIL with benchmarks and a schedule by March 2006; 
Requests the Secretary-General to regularly inform the Council on UNMIL's progress; 
Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
